newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai B share index closes at record low.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai B share index closes at record low.

text.p: Shanghai's B share index on Monday ended at a record closing low for the fourth successive day, with long-term investors liquidating their positions due to very weak market sentiment, brokers said.

The index fell 0.809 points or 1.77 percent to 44.867, on volume of 5.8 million shares worth $2.1 million. In intra-day trading on Monday, the index hit an all-time low of 44.803 points, surpassing the record of 45.585 points last Friday.
Brokers said that successive record lows over the past two weeks had badly hit sentiment. There was little buying on the market and light selling easily pushed down the index.
"Overseas investors were seen selling their shares more actively given the lack of signs of recovery in the short-term after a long bearish run," one broker said.
"The index is likely to continue to move down if there is no positive news," a second broker said. "We may see it go as low as 42 points this week."
Shanghai Rubber Belt was the biggest loser on speculative selling, plunging $0.036 or 23.37 percent to $0.118 on volume of 50,600 shares.
Shanghai Shangling Electric Appliance followed on institutional selling with concerns about its results amid competition in the domestic refrigerator market, brokers said.
It fell $0.040 or 13.33 percent to $0.260 on volume of 153,000 shares.

Shanghai New Asia saw heavy liquidation selling and failed to hold to the high price levels reached recently, brokers said. It was the most heavily-traded stock, ending down $0.026 or 5.46 percent to $0.450, on volume of 1.5 million shares.
The Shanghai A share index rose on a technical rebound, but trading remained slow, brokers said.

The A index rose 15.769 points or 1.63 percent to 983.659 points, on volume of 332.4 million shares worth 3.1 billion yuan. The SSE 30 blue-chip index gained 32.799 points or 1.37 percent to 2431.227 points.
Shanxi Xinghuacon Fenjiu Distillery was the star on speculative buying, jumping 0.91 yuan or 13.20 percent to 7.80 yuan on volume of 15.9 million shares.
